trans-unit.source: Represents an ordered collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> values.

Members of this class behave exactly as described by the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>, <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601>, and <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> documentation, except that this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to insert `null` into the collection.

**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> class provides several special features: <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.

For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*oneOrMoreVectors*
One or more vector values, with each pair delimited by a single comma and/or one or more spaces:
<xref:System.Windows.Vector> *[delimeter* <xref:System.Windows.Vector> *]\**
*oneOrMoreVectorObjectElements*
One or more <xref:System.Windows.Vector> values, declared using object element syntax.
XAML Implicit Collection Usage
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> class that contains items copied from the specified collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> values and has the same initial capacity as the number of items copied.
The collection whose items are copied to the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
collection is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> class with the specified capacity.
The number of <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> values that the collection is initially capable of storing.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601.Add%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to add a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to add to the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
value is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Removes all items from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
This method does not change the capacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> contains the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the items of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> to an array, starting at the specified array index.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the items copied from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of items in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Gets the number of items contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The number of items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection.Enumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
Determines the index of the specified item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the ; otherwise, -1.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> into the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> at the specified index.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Insert%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to insert a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
value is `null`.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> at the specified index.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Item%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to insert a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> at the specified index.
value is `null`.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Converts a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of a collection of vectors into an equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of the collection of vectors.
Returns the equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
Removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
`true` if value was removed from the ; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> to remove.
Creates a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.

Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Vector.Y"></xref> values of the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> structures in this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
Culture-specific formatting information.

Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Vector.Y"></xref> values of the <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> structures in this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1.IsReadOnly"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601> interface.
`true` if the the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
A zero-based <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The first position in the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to receive the copied contents.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which to insert the <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` if the the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` if the the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.IFormattable.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VectorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.IFormattable> interface.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The <xref href="System.IFormatProvider"></xref> to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
